title: Cape Hatteras National Seashore: Eating & Sleeping
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Eating & Sleeping             Eating & Sleeping        Camping near Cape Hatteras Lighthouse National Park Service           The Outer Banks Visitors Bureau logo Outer Banks Visitors Bureau  Eating The Outer Banks of North Carolina have some of the best seafood to be found anywhere. Restaurants in the villages around the seashore serve fresh, locally caught seafood, as well as an array of other types of food. To find listings of restaurants, check out the Outer Banks Visitor Bureau and the Ocracoke Civic and Business Association.          Ocracoke Civic and Business Association logo Ocracoke Civic and Business Association  Sleeping There are four NPS-operated campgrounds along the seashore.  Oregon Inlet Campground on Bodie Island Cape Point Campground on Hatteras Island Frisco Campground on Hatteras Island Ocracoke Campground on Ocracoke Island  For other lodging options, check out the Outer Banks Visitor Bureau and the Ocracoke Civic and Business Association.
